Sentencas: The open circuit voltage (OCV) of solid oxide fuel cells is generally overestimated by the Nernst equation and the Wagner equation, due to the polarization losses at electrodes.
Titulo: An open circuit voltage equation enabling separation of cathode and anode polarization resistances of ceria electrolyte based solid oxide fuel cells

Titulo: An open circuit voltage equation enabling separation of cathode and anode polarization resistances of ceria electrolyte based solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: [Omega cm(2)] denotes the ionic resistance of electrolyte, and the polarization resistances of cathode and anode, respectively).
Titulo: An open circuit voltage equation enabling separation of cathode and anode polarization resistances of ceria electrolyte based solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This equation approaches to the Wagner equation when the electrodes are highly active (r(c) and r(a) -> 0), and approaches to the Nernst equation when the electrolyte is a purely ionic conductor (p* -> 0).
Titulo: An open circuit voltage equation enabling separation of cathode and anode polarization resistances of ceria electrolyte based solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: For the fuel cells whose OCV is well below the prediction of the Wagner equation, for example with thin doped ceria electrolyte, it is demonstrated that the combination of OCV and impedance spectroscopy measurements allows the determination of p*, R-c and R-a.
Titulo: An open circuit voltage equation enabling separation of cathode and anode polarization resistances of ceria electrolyte based solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: This equation can serve as a simple yet powerful tool to study the internal losses in the cell under open circuit condition.
Titulo: An open circuit voltage equation enabling separation of cathode and anode polarization resistances of ceria electrolyte based solid oxide fuel cells
